td.content: s:a male aged 23 ys C/O intrusive thoughts, intense nightmares and feeling keyed up. NKDA. he has a history of smoking he drinks 2 beers per night o:Height 166 cm, Weight 77.4 kg, Temperature 36.9 C, Pulse 76, SystolicBP 111, DiastolicBP 72, Respiration 16, Special screening for other specified conditions using BDI screen results (31) indication of severe depression, distant memories are impaired, difficulty counting back to seven, decline in grooming and hygiene can be observed, severe motor retardation = slow speech, movements, low energy, Patient looked tired and agitated, hypervigilant throughout exam, Recurrent thoughts of death, delusion of guilt a:intense nightmares p:performed Special screening for other specified conditions, and performed E/M Level 2 (new patient) - Completed, and referred patient to psychology.

td.content: s:white male aged 23 years complains of intrusive thoughts x 6 weeks. pt experienced trauma during car accident approx. 3 years ago. he also reports intense nightmares, feeling keyed up. he consumes 2 drinks per night he has approx. a 30 pack/year history of smoking o:patient noted he feels close to his sister and close cousin and has often relied on them for support during past difficulties, including crisis situations. distant memories are impaired, difficulty counting back to seven, decline in grooming and hygiene can be observed, severe motor retardation = slow speech, movements, low energy, Patient looked tired and agitated, hypervigilant throughout exam, Recurrent thoughts of death, delusion of guilt. BDI 31, CAPS B=3,C=5,D=4 a:Post Traumatic Stress Disorder p:in consideration of all factors, including availability and strength of support network, pt is not deemed to present an immediate threat to self or others and will remain in present course of treatment. performed BDI, CAPS, and performed socialization to treatment - Explained that symptoms were common for someone having experienced such trauma; socialization to treatment - Discussed Safety Plan; counseling about life problems - Discussed other life issues - learned that patient had concern about their drug abuse; counseling about life problems - Suggested various social services available for helping to handle their drug abuse; counseling about life problems - Discussed with patient their social support network; Psychiatric diagnostic evaluation - Completed, and ordered homework (fill out standard intake forms), homework (read handouts about PTSD therapy).

td.content: s:23 yo male student presents with intense nightmares, feeling keyed up. he has history of intrusive thoughts stemming from exposure to car accident (8/1/2010). o:patient speaks fondly about his sister, with whom he visits regularly and calls a "strong base of support" in his life. distant memories are impaired, difficulty counting back to seven, decline in grooming and hygiene can be observed, severe motor retardation = slow speech, movements, low energy, Patient looked tired and agitated, hypervigilant throughout exam, Recurrent thoughts of death, delusion of guilt. Review of intake forms done, BDI 31, Suicide assessment high a:Post Traumatic Stress Disorder p:in consideration of all factors, including availability and strength of support network, pt is not deemed to present an immediate threat to self or others and will remain in present course of treatment. performed Review of intake forms, BDI, Suicide assessment, and performed socialization to treatment - Discussed homework - helped patient start to fill in goal worksheet; counseling about life problems - Discussed social services to help with their drug abuse; social service referral - Patient agreed they wanted to try NA; socialization to treatment - Discussed Cognitive-behavioral model of PTSD and that such treatments were mostly contraindicated until patient has stabilized and reduced level of anxiety; socialization to treatment - Discussed value of anxiety management exercises; anxiety management skills - Asked patient to list activities that were found to be relaxing; anxiety management skills - Asked patient to choose a previously close confidant to reengage with; Psychotherapy, 60 minutes - Completed, and ordered homework (finish writing goals for therapy), homework (set up appointment with social service), homework (participate in some of the activities identified as relaxing), homework (attempt to contact previously supportive person and talk with them).

Term.LATERALITY: Effect of exposure to external cause

content2.Unmatched: distant memories are impaired , difficulty counting back
support network , pt is not deemed

Value.Value: Review of intake forms , BDI , Suicide

td.content: s:23 yo white M student c/o 10 days h/o intense nightmares, intrusive thoughts and feeling keyed up stemming from exposure to report (8/1/2010). o:patient speaks fondly about his brother, with whom he visits regularly and calls a "strong base of support" in his life. distant memories are impaired, difficulty counting back to seven, decline in grooming and hygiene can be observed, severe motor retardation = slow speech, movements, low energy, Patient looked tired and agitated, hypervigilant throughout exam, Recurrent thoughts of death, delusion of guilt. Review of patient goals done a:Post Traumatic Stress Disorder p:in consideration of all factors, including availability and strength of support network, patient is not deemed to present an immediate threat to self or others and will remain in present course of treatment. performed Review of patient goals, and performed socialization to treatment - Reviewed Safety Plan in light of homework; counseling about life problems - Discussed patient interaction with NA; social service referral - Patient agreed to continue working with them; socialization to treatment - Reviewed relaxation activities since last appointment; socialization to treatment - Reviewed attempt to reengage with former socially supportive person; anxiety management skills - Sleep disruption exercises: discussed sleep hygiene and deep breathing for reengaging with sleep; Psychotherapy, 60 minutes - Completed, and ordered homework (practice anxiety management skills), homework (Continue to participate in activities listed as relaxing), homework (Attempt to have second positive interaction with reengaged support person).

Term.LATERALITY: Effect of exposure to external cause

td.content: s:m aged 23 yrs c/o 7 weeks h/o intense nightmares, feeling keyed up and intrusive thoughts stemming from exposure to report (8/1/2010). o:patient speaks fondly about his close cousin, with whom he visits regularly and calls a "strong base of support" in his life. distant memories are impaired, difficulty counting back to seven, decline in grooming and hygiene can be observed, severe motor retardation = slow speech, movements, low energy, Patient looked tired and agitated, hypervigilant throughout exam, Recurrent thoughts of death, delusion of guilt. a:Post Traumatic Stress Disorder p:in consideration of all factors, including availability and strength of support network, pt is not deemed to present an immediate threat to self or others and will remain in present course of treatment. performed social service referral - Review patient interaction with NA; social service referral - Received permission from patient to call patient's NA counselor; anxiety management skills - Breathing relaxation skill taught; anxiety management skills - Thought stopping skill taught; socialization to treatment - Reviewed relaxation activities since last appointment; socialization to treatment - Reviewed attempt to reengage with former socially supportive person; anxiety management skills - Sleep disruption exercises: discussed sleep hygiene and deep breathing for reengaging with sleep; Psychotherapy, 60 minutes - Completed, and ordered homework (practice anxiety management skills), homework (Continue to participate in activities listed as relaxing).

Term.LATERALITY: Effect of exposure to external cause

td.content: s:23 yr old white male student presents with intrusive thoughts, vivid flashbacks and difficulty focusing on daily activities. Reports traumatized by car accident, 8/1/2010. o:avoidance of thoughts associated with events, 2/3 recall at 3 times, oriented x 2, Patient looked tired, appears very agitated, hypervigilance throughout the exam, Affect was congruent. CAPS B=3,C=4,D=3. a:Post Traumatic Stress Disorder p:performed CAPS, and performed social service referral - Discussed with patient that NA counselor was pleased with progress; anxiety management skills - Breathing relaxation skill practiced; anxiety management skills - Thought stopping skill practiced; anxiety management skills - Progressive muscle relaxation skill taught; Psychotherapy, 60 minutes - Completed, and ordered homework (practice anxiety management skills), socialization to treatment.

Value.Value: CAPS , and performed social service referral - Discussed with patient that NA counselor was pleased with progress; anxiety management skills - Breathing relaxation skill practiced; anxiety management skills - Thought stopping skill practiced; anxiety management skills - Progressive muscle relaxation skill taught; Psychotherapy , 60 minutes - Completed ,

content2.Value: CAPS , and performed social service referral - Discussed with patient that NA counselor was pleased with progress; anxiety management skills - Breathing relaxation skill practiced; anxiety management skills - Thought stopping skill practiced; anxiety management skills - Progressive muscle relaxation skill taught; Psychotherapy , 60 minutes - Completed ,

Value.Value: ordered homework (practice anxiety management skills) , socialization to treatment

content2.Value: ordered homework (practice anxiety management skills) , socialization to treatment

td.content: s:23 yr old white M c/o 5 weeks h/o vivid flashbacks, intrusive thoughts and difficulty focusing on daily activities. Traumatized approx. 3 years ago when exposed to car accident. o:avoidance of thoughts associated with events, 2/3 recall at 3 times, oriented x 2, Patient looked tired, appears very agitated, hypervigilance throughout the exam, Affect was congruent. Suicide assessment moderate. a:Post Traumatic Stress Disorder p:performed Suicide assessment, and performed anxiety management skills - Breathing relaxation and progressive muscle relaxation skills practiced; anxiety management skills - Thought stopping skill practiced; cognitive-behavioral interventions - Socratic dialog used to help patient understand that choices made at time of the traumatic incident were rational at the time; Psychotherapy, 60 minutes - Completed, and ordered homework (practice anxiety management skills).

Value.Value: Suicide

content2.Value: Suicide

Value.Value: anxiety management skills - Breathing relaxation and progressive muscle relaxation skills practiced; anxiety management skills - Thought stopping skill practiced; cognitive - behavioral interventions - Socratic dialog used to help patient understand that choices made at time of the traumatic incident were rational at the time; Psychotherapy , 60 minutes - Completed ,

content2.Value: anxiety management skills - Breathing relaxation and progressive muscle relaxation skills practiced; anxiety management skills - Thought stopping skill practiced; cognitive - behavioral interventions - Socratic dialog used to help patient understand that choices made at time of the traumatic incident were rational at the time; Psychotherapy , 60 minutes - Completed ,

td.content: s:23 yo white male student presents with disrupted sleep, difficulty participating in activities and intrusive thoughts. These symptoms are present for about 2 weeks. Patient experienced trauma: car accident approx. 3 years ago. o:appropriate behavior with no abnormal movement, good eye contact, appears agitated, denies suicidal/homicidal ideation intent or plan, normal speech but slow rate, oriented x 3, poor concentration, affect is appropriate with normal range. BDI 19. a:Post Traumatic Stress Disorder p:performed BDI, and performed socialization to treatment - Discuss with patient the good progress that they are making in therapy: better able to face the trauma, better able to handle their drug abuse, better able to interact with others; assessment of treatment progress - Patient agrees that they also see the progress; assessment of treatment progress - Patient agrees to delay follow-up date to 1 month out; cognitive-behavioral interventions - Discuss with patient their changes in interaction with others since therapy had begun; Psychotherapy, 45 minutes - Completed.

td.content: s:male aged 23 ys c/o 4 days h/o difficulty participating in activities, intrusive thoughts and disrupted sleep. Reports issues began with car accident, 8/1/2010. o:appropriate behavior with no abnormal movement, good eye contact, appears agitated, denies suicidal/homicidal ideation intent or plan, normal speech but slow rate, oriented x 3, poor concentration, affect is appropriate with normal range. a:Post Traumatic Stress Disorder p:performed socialization to treatment - Review Safety Plan; cognitive-behavioral interventions - Teach techniques for overcoming patient overgeneralizations; assessment of treatment progress - Discuss end-of-treatment scenarios; assessment of treatment progress - Patient suggests that there be one more session and then we try holding off on additional sessions; Psychotherapy, 45 minutes - Completed, and ordered homework (practice new cognitive modification techniques).

td.content: s:23 YO white m c/o 6 weeks h/o difficulty concentrating, trouble sleeping and nightmares. Reports problem started with car accident, 8/1/2010. o:good concentration, mood is euthymic, affect is appropriate with normal range, alert and oriented x 3, normal speech with normal rhythm, Heart = normal S1, S2, RRR. a:Post Traumatic Stress Disorder p:performed assessment of treatment progress - Agree to not schedule a followup unless/until patient needs one; counseling about life problems - Discuss with patient the importance of continuing to work with NA for addressing issues stemming from their drug abuse; cognitive-behavioral interventions - Review techniques that worked best for patient over course of treatment; cognitive-behavioral interventions - Review various approaches patient can use when crises arise; Psychotherapy, 45 minutes - Completed.
